intro: Saussurea laevigata, commonly known as the smooth saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or alpine environments, and is adapted to cold climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine, soft hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. Saussurea laevigata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
